sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And though the time for buying presents is theoretically running out, there is still a wonderful thing you can give your family and the whole country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And that is to get that jab, whether it's your first or your second or your booster, so that next year's festivities are even better than this year's.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All public New Year's Eve celebrations have been cancelled in Italy and face masks are to become compulsory outdoors again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mounting cases driven by Omicron have forced the authorities to impose new restrictions measures despite nearly 90% of Italians being fully vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A date for the new mask rule is yet to be announced by the Health Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Masks will also be mandatory outdoors and we are envisaging a provision requiring an FFP2 mask, the most protective type of mask, for certain areas such as long distance transport, local public transport, cinemas, theatres, museums, indoor sporting events and even stadiums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Denmark will require foreigners entering the country to provide a negative test from Monday, regardless of their vaccination status. Schools, theatres and amusement parks are closed, but the Danish government don't think a full lockdown is necessary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: High vaccination rates is allowing Christmas celebrations to go ahead in Sweden despite the fast rising new infections and pressures on the healthcare system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Thirty-nine people are dead and dozens more injured after a fire swept through a river ferry in southern Bangladesh early on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The rescue mission is ongoing and authorities fear casualties are likely to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to officials, the blaze broke out around 3am on the ship that was travelling through the Jalokate district on the Suganda river.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The ferry departed from the country's capital Dhaka carrying 800 passengers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ferries are one of the main modes of transportation in the wetlands of Bangladesh, made up of the Ganges Delta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Accidents are common and are often blamed on overcrowding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: South Korea has pardoned the former president Park Geun-hye, who was serving a 22-year prison term for corruption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to the presidential office, her failing health and public unity were some of the reasons taken into consideration when granting the clemency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We've included former President Park Geun-hye and former Prime Minister Han Myung-suk in the list of pardons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We've done so to overcome this unfortunate past, to create unity to overcome the COVID-19 pandemic and the pan-national crisis, and to provide a chance to take a new step forward towards the future." Park Geun-hye was South Korea's first female president and the first democratically elected leader there to be forcibly removed from office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In 2018, she was found guilty of multiple counts of abuse of power, bribery and coercion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The charges prompted months of massive street protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The perestroika, a program of reform designed to boost the economy within the communist regime, visibly revitalized the dwindling USSR in 1985.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However the struggling superpower was still gripped by an arms race and years of mismanagement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The unity of 15 Soviet republics, applauded by communist propaganda, was quickly disintegrating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Leading the charge, the Caucasus region rebelled against Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Baltic countries followed suit while Lithuania declared its independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But in January 1991, Moscow intervened and fired on demonstrators.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yet this attempt at taming the insurrection failed and Lithuania became the first republic to officially break away, declaring its independence in the act of March 11 in 1919.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Nevertheless, the fatal blow to the USSR came on August 19. Soviets woke to the news that the eighth and final leader of the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev, was unable to govern for health reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Committee on the State of Emergency was immediately created to save the country from submerging into chaos and anarchy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Following the announcement, tanks entered Moscow, public meetings were banned and pro-reform newspapers were shut down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the Committee's rule collapsed within two days, it proved to be the catalyst to a long string of events that would soon end the Soviet Union. Boris Yeltsin, the president of the Russian Federation, emerged victorious, while Gorbachev returned weaker than ever. Moscow's government struggled to retain its influence following the failed coup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Many republics such as Ukraine and the Baltic states proclaimed their independence in the days and months that followed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a move to recognize each other's independence, Russian, Ukrainian and Belarusian leaders officially abandoned ship on December 8 and signed the Commonwealth of Independent States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On December 26th, a day after President Gorbachev stepped down and the Soviet red flag was replaced with a Russian tricolour, the USSR was formally dissolved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A jury of 12 has found Kim Potter, the former Brooklyn Centre police officer who shot and killed Daunte Wright, guilty on counts of both first and second degree manslaughter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Judge Regina Chu has ordered Potter, 49, to be taken into custody immediately.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Records confirm that she has been transferred to the women's prison in Shakopee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Records confirm that she has been transferred to the women's prison in Shakopee. Tourists are returning to Finnish Lapland after the coronavirus pandemic all but cancelled last year's winter travel season at the festive destination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There are currently no hugs with Father Christmas at Santa Claus Village amusement park in Ravaniemi, the capital of Finnish Lapland. Visitors are separated from Santa by a gingerbread cookie shaped plexiglass screen.
